title: Implement Hindley-Milner type inference engine
body:
Implement the Hindley-Milner type inference algorithm for Rusholme.

**Deliverables:**
- Unification engine: `unify(type1, type2) -> Substitution | TypeError`
- Type variable generation (fresh type variables)
- Type environment: maps names to type schemes (`forall a. ...`)
- `infer(env, expr) -> (type, substitution)` — Algorithm W or Algorithm J
- Generalisation (let-polymorphism): `let id = \x -> x in (id 1, id True)`
- Instantiation of polymorphic types at use sites
- Emit type error diagnostics via `DiagnosticCollector`
- Unit tests:
  - Literal types
  - Lambda/application
  - Let-polymorphism
  - Occurs check (reject infinite types)
  - Basic error cases

**Design notes:**
- Algorithm W is simpler; Algorithm J is more efficient. Either is fine for v1.
- Type classes are handled separately (05-04)
- This operates on the AST and produces typed Core
